episode_summary: This episode features a compilation of facts submitted by the audience during a live show, covering a wide range of topics including historical events, animal behaviors, and quirky anecdotes. The hosts discuss the evolution of language, historical coincidences, and unusual animal adaptations, among other intriguing subjects.

facts.fact: The word 'soon' used to mean right now, but people would misuse it, and so it came to mean in a bit.
The number plate of the car in which Franz Ferdinand was shot is the date that World War One ended.
Australian bushrangers would put their horseshoes on their horses backwards so that their tracks would appear to be going in the opposite direction.
The US military blasted AC/DC music at General Noriega's compound in Panama for two days continuously to remove him, and he surrendered as a result.
